summary: Over the last 20 years, DOD has increasingly deployed its Special Operations Forces around the world to address the nation's most complex and sensitive security challenges. The number of personnel that perform this work has increased—from 45,700 in FY 2001 to 73,900 in FY 2021. DOD collects and uses data to oversee these forces while they are deployed. But the data itself has problems. For...
title: Special Operations Forces: Better Data Necessary to Improve Oversight and Address Command and Control Challenges
